column4: Hello, I rather suddenly began getting piss-poor performance when accessing files on an NTFS partition.  I'm not sure how to go about fixing this... any advice?
defrag it?
done.  Either way the problem only occurs under ubuntu
make sure youre using the ntfs-3g drivers
also done
and this is a problem with *reading* files, not writing, strangely enough
not sure then, a reboot might help?
if you don't know that's okay but suggesting a reboot isn't very constructive
you would be surprised how many times that helped
sure, but like I said before, I tried defragging it under windows and it performs just fine under windows.  Both of these statements imply a reboot
not necessarily, but I can understand how you think that would be the case
What is the % free space on the used partition?
let me check real quick
about 60% full
an ssd -_-
that makes a huge difference
yeah forgot to mention that bit
fragmentation doesnt exist on SSD's
sure it does.  It just gets accessed in constant time.
Im not sure, but try mounting it with noatime
yep I tried that too.  noatime and nodiratime (although I believe the latter is implied by the former...)
